intro: Persea gigantea, commonly known as the giant persimmon, is a large evergreen tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It can grow up to 30 meters tall, featuring broad,革质 (leathery) leaves that are elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange to red, fleshy fruits that are edible when fully ripe.
